functions.name: pi
functions.description: Returns the xs:double value of the mathematical constant π whose lexical representation is 3.141592653589793.

functions.name: sqrt
functions.description:
Returns the square root of $arg.
If $arg is the empty sequence, the empty sequence is returned.
Otherwise the result is the xs:double value of the mathematical square root of $arg.

functions.name: sin
functions.description:
Returns the sine of the $arg, expressed in radians.
If $arg is the empty sequence, the empty sequence is returned.
Otherwise the result is the sine of $arg, treated as an angle in radians.

functions.name: cos
functions.description:
Returns the cosine of $arg, expressed in radians.
If $arg is the empty sequence, the empty sequence is returned.
Otherwise the result is the cosine of $arg, treated as an angle in radians.

functions.name: tan
functions.description:
Returns the tangent of $arg, expressed in radians.
If $arg is the empty sequence, the empty sequence is returned.
Otherwise the result is the tangent of $arg, treated as an angle in radians.

functions.name: asin
functions.description:
Returns the arc sine of $arg.
If $arg is the empty sequence, the empty sequence is returned.
Otherwise the result is the arc sine of $arg, returned as an angle in radians in the range -π/2 to +π/2.

functions.name: acos
functions.description:
Returns the arc cosine of $arg.
If $arg is the empty sequence, the empty sequence is returned.
Otherwise the result is the arc cosine of $arg, returned as an angle in radians in the range 0 to +π.

functions.name: atan
functions.description:
Returns the arc tangent of $arg.
If $arg is the empty sequence, the empty sequence is returned.
Otherwise the result is the arc tangent of $arg, returned as an angle in radians in the range -π/2 to +π/2.

functions.name: atan2
functions.description:
Returns the arc tangent of $arg1 divided by $arg2, the result being in the range -π/2 to +π/2 radians.
If $arg1 is the empty sequence, the empty sequence is returned.
Otherwise the result is the arc tangent of $arg1 divided by $arg2, returned as an angle in radians in the range -π to +π.

functions.name: pow
functions.description:
Returns $arg1 raised to the power of $arg2.
If $arg1 is the empty sequence, the empty sequence is returned.
Otherwise the result is the $arg1 raised to the power of $arg2.

functions.name: exp
functions.description:
Returns e raised to the power of $arg.
If $arg is the empty sequence, the empty sequence is returned.
Otherwise the result is the value of e raised to the power of $arg.

functions.name: log
functions.description:
Returns the natural logarithm of $arg.
If $arg is the empty sequence, the empty sequence is returned.
Otherwise the result is the natural logarithm (base e) of $arg.

functions.name: log10
functions.description:
Returns the base 10 logarithm of $arg.
If $arg is the empty sequence, the empty sequence is returned.
Otherwise the result is the base 10 logarithm of $arg.

functions.name: e
functions.description: Returns the xs:double value of the mathematical constant e whose lexical representation is 2.718281828459045.

functions.name: sinh
functions.description:
Returns the hyperbolic sine of $arg.
If $arg is the empty sequence, the empty sequence is returned.
Otherwise the result is the hyperbolic sine of $arg.

functions.name: cosh
functions.description:
Returns the hyperbolic cosine of $arg.
If $arg is the empty sequence, the empty sequence is returned.
Otherwise the result is the hyperbolic cosine of $arg.

functions.name: tanh
functions.description:
Returns the hyperbolic tangent of $arg.
If $arg is the empty sequence, the empty sequence is returned.
Otherwise the result is the hyperbolic tangent of $arg.

functions.name: crc32
functions.description:
Calculates the CRC32 check sum of the given $string.
If an empty sequence is supplied, the empty sequence is returned.

http://www.w3.org/2005/xpath-functions/m.description: The math XQuery Module defines functions to perform mathematical operations, such as pi, asin and acos. Most functions are specified in the Functions and Operators Specification of the upcoming XQuery 3.0 Recommendation, and some additional ones have been added in this module.

functions.name: error
functions.description: Calling the fn:error function raises an application-defined error.

functions.name: error
functions.description: Calling the fn:error function raises an application-defined error.

functions.name: error
functions.description: Calling the fn:error function raises an application-defined error.

functions.name: error
functions.description: Calling the fn:error function raises an application-defined error.

functions.name: trace
functions.description: Provides an execution trace intended to be used in debugging queries.

functions.name: trace
functions.description: Provides an execution trace intended to be used in debugging queries.

functions.name: abs
functions.description: Returns the absolute value of $arg.

functions.name: ceiling
functions.description: Rounds $arg upwards to a whole number.

functions.name: floor
functions.description: Rounds $arg downwards to a whole number.

functions.name: round
functions.description: Rounds a value to a specified number of decimal places, rounding upwards if two such values are equally near.

functions.name: round
functions.description: Rounds a value to a specified number of decimal places, rounding upwards if two such values are equally near.

functions.name: round-half-to-even
functions.description: Rounds a value to a specified number of decimal places, rounding to make the last digit even if two such values are equally near.

functions.name: round-half-to-even
functions.description: Rounds a value to a specified number of decimal places, rounding to make the last digit even if two such values are equally near.

functions.name: number
functions.description: Returns the value indicated by $arg or, if $arg is not specified, the context item after atomization, converted to an xs:double.

functions.name: number
functions.description: Returns the value indicated by $arg or, if $arg is not specified, the context item after atomization, converted to an xs:double.

functions.name: format-integer
functions.description: Formats an integer according to a given picture string, using the conventions of a given natural language if specified.

functions.name: format-integer
functions.description: Formats an integer according to a given picture string, using the conventions of a given natural language if specified.

functions.name: format-number
functions.description: Returns a string containing a number formatted according to a given picture string, taking account of decimal formats specified in the static context.

functions.name: format-number
functions.description: Returns a string containing a number formatted according to a given picture string, taking account of decimal formats specified in the static context.

functions.name: random-number-generator
functions.description: Returns a random number generator, which can be used to generate sequences of random numbers.

functions.name: random-number-generator
functions.description: Returns a random number generator, which can be used to generate sequences of random numbers.

functions.name: codepoints-to-string
functions.description: Returns an xs:string whose characters have supplied codepoints.

functions.name: string-to-codepoints
functions.description: Returns the sequence of codepoints that constitute an xs:string value.

functions.name: compare
functions.description: Returns -1, 0, or 1, depending on whether $comparand1 collates before, equal to, or after $comparand2 according to the rules of a selected collation.

functions.name: compare
functions.description: Returns -1, 0, or 1, depending on whether $comparand1 collates before, equal to, or after $comparand2 according to the rules of a selected collation.

functions.name: codepoint-equal
functions.description: Returns true if two strings are equal, considered codepoint-by-codepoint.

functions.name: collation-key
functions.description: Given a string value and a collation, generates an internal value called a collation key, with the property that the matching and ordering of collation keys reflects the matching and ordering of strings under the specified collation.

functions.name: collation-key
functions.description: Given a string value and a collation, generates an internal value called a collation key, with the property that the matching and ordering of collation keys reflects the matching and ordering of strings under the specified collation.

functions.name: contains-token
functions.description: Determines whether or not any of the supplied strings, when tokenized at whitespace boundaries, contains the supplied token, under the rules of the supplied collation.

functions.name: contains-token
functions.description: Determines whether or not any of the supplied strings, when tokenized at whitespace boundaries, contains the supplied token, under the rules of the supplied collation.

functions.name: concat
functions.description: Returns the concatenation of the string values of the arguments.

functions.name: string-join
functions.description: Returns a string created by concatenating the items in a sequence, with a defined separator between adjacent items.

functions.name: string-join
functions.description: Returns a string created by concatenating the items in a sequence, with a defined separator between adjacent items.

functions.name: substring
functions.description: Returns the portion of the value of $sourceString beginning at the position indicated by the value of $start and continuing for the number of characters indicated by the value of $length.

functions.name: substring
functions.description: Returns the portion of the value of $sourceString beginning at the position indicated by the value of $start and continuing for the number of characters indicated by the value of $length.

functions.name: string-length
functions.description: Returns the number of characters in a string.

functions.name: string-length
functions.description: Returns the number of characters in a string.

functions.name: normalize-space
functions.description: Returns the value of $arg with leading and trailing whitespace removed, and sequences of internal whitespace reduced to a single space character.

functions.name: normalize-space
functions.description: Returns the value of $arg with leading and trailing whitespace removed, and sequences of internal whitespace reduced to a single space character.

functions.name: normalize-unicode
functions.description: Returns the value of $arg after applying Unicode normalization.

functions.name: normalize-unicode
functions.description: Returns the value of $arg after applying Unicode normalization.

functions.name: upper-case
functions.description: Converts a string to upper case.

functions.name: lower-case
functions.description: Converts a string to lower case.

functions.name: translate
functions.description: Returns the value of $arg modified by replacing or removing individual characters.

functions.name: contains
functions.description: Returns true if the string $arg1 contains $arg2 as a substring, taking collations into account.

functions.name: contains
functions.description: Returns true if the string $arg1 contains $arg2 as a substring, taking collations into account.

functions.name: starts-with
functions.description: Returns true if the string $arg1 contains $arg2 as a leading substring, taking collations into account.

functions.name: starts-with
functions.description: Returns true if the string $arg1 contains $arg2 as a leading substring, taking collations into account.

functions.name: ends-with
functions.description: Returns true if the string $arg1 contains $arg2 as a trailing substring, taking collations into account.

functions.name: ends-with
functions.description: Returns true if the string $arg1 contains $arg2 as a trailing substring, taking collations into account.

functions.name: substring-before
functions.description: Returns the part of $arg1 that precedes the first occurrence of $arg2, taking collations into account.

functions.name: substring-before
functions.description: Returns the part of $arg1 that precedes the first occurrence of $arg2, taking collations into account.

functions.name: substring-after
functions.description: Returns the part of $arg1 that follows the first occurrence of $arg2, taking collations into account.

functions.name: substring-after
functions.description: Returns the part of $arg1 that follows the first occurrence of $arg2, taking collations into account.

functions.name: matches
functions.description: Returns true if the supplied string matches a given regular expression.

functions.name: matches
functions.description: Returns true if the supplied string matches a given regular expression.

functions.name: replace
functions.description: Returns a string produced from the input string by replacing any substrings that match a given regular expression with a supplied replacement string.

functions.name: replace
functions.description: Returns a string produced from the input string by replacing any substrings that match a given regular expression with a supplied replacement string.

functions.name: tokenize
functions.description: Returns a sequence of strings constructed by splitting the input wherever a separator is found; the separator is any substring that matches a given regular expression.

functions.name: tokenize
functions.description: Returns a sequence of strings constructed by splitting the input wherever a separator is found; the separator is any substring that matches a given regular expression.

functions.name: tokenize
functions.description: Returns a sequence of strings constructed by splitting the input wherever a separator is found; the separator is any substring that matches a given regular expression.

functions.name: analyze-string
functions.description: Analyzes a string using a regular expression, returning an XML structure that identifies which parts of the input string matched or failed to match the regular expression, and in the case of matched substrings, which substrings matched each capturing group in the regular expression.

functions.name: analyze-string
functions.description: Analyzes a string using a regular expression, returning an XML structure that identifies which parts of the input string matched or failed to match the regular expression, and in the case of matched substrings, which substrings matched each capturing group in the regular expression.

functions.name: true
functions.description: Returns the xs:boolean value true.

functions.name: false
functions.description: Returns the xs:boolean value false.

functions.name: boolean
functions.description: Computes the effective boolean value of the sequence $arg.

functions.name: not
functions.description: Returns true if the effective boolean value of $arg is false, or false if it is true.

functions.name: years-from-duration
functions.description: Returns the number of years in a duration.

functions.name: months-from-duration
functions.description: Returns the number of months in a duration.

functions.name: days-from-duration
functions.description: Returns the number of days in a duration.

functions.name: hours-from-duration
functions.description: Returns the number of hours in a duration.

functions.name: minutes-from-duration
functions.description: Returns the number of minutes in a duration.

functions.name: seconds-from-duration
functions.description: Returns the number of seconds in a duration.

functions.name: dateTime
functions.description: Returns an xs:dateTime value created by combining an xs:date and an xs:time.

functions.name: year-from-dateTime
functions.description: Returns the year component of an xs:dateTime.

functions.name: month-from-dateTime
functions.description: Returns the month component of an xs:dateTime.

functions.name: day-from-dateTime
functions.description: Returns the day component of an xs:dateTime.

functions.name: hours-from-dateTime
functions.description: Returns the hours component of an xs:dateTime.

functions.name: minutes-from-dateTime
functions.description: Returns the minute component of an xs:dateTime.

functions.name: seconds-from-dateTime
functions.description: Returns the seconds component of an xs:dateTime.

functions.name: timezone-from-dateTime
functions.description: Returns the timezone component of an xs:dateTime.

functions.name: year-from-date
functions.description: Returns the year component of an xs:date.

functions.name: month-from-date
functions.description: Returns the month component of an xs:date.

functions.name: day-from-date
functions.description: Returns the day component of an xs:date.

functions.name: timezone-from-date
functions.description: Returns the timezone component of an xs:date.

functions.name: hours-from-time
functions.description: Returns the hours component of an xs:time.

functions.name: minutes-from-time
functions.description: Returns the minutes component of an xs:time.

functions.name: seconds-from-time
functions.description: Returns the seconds component of an xs:time.

functions.name: timezone-from-time
functions.description: Returns the timezone component of an xs:time.

functions.name: adjust-dateTime-to-timezone
functions.description: Adjusts an xs:dateTime value to a specific timezone, or to no timezone at all.

functions.name: adjust-dateTime-to-timezone
functions.description: Adjusts an xs:dateTime value to a specific timezone, or to no timezone at all.

functions.name: adjust-date-to-timezone
functions.description: Adjusts an xs:date value to a specific timezone, or to no timezone at all; the result is the date in the target timezone that contains the starting instant of the supplied date.

functions.name: adjust-date-to-timezone
functions.description: Adjusts an xs:date value to a specific timezone, or to no timezone at all; the result is the date in the target timezone that contains the starting instant of the supplied date.

functions.name: adjust-time-to-timezone
functions.description: Adjusts an xs:time value to a specific timezone, or to no timezone at all.

functions.name: adjust-time-to-timezone
functions.description: Adjusts an xs:time value to a specific timezone, or to no timezone at all.

functions.name: format-dateTime
functions.description: Returns a string containing an xs:dateTime value formatted for display.

functions.name: format-dateTime
functions.description: Returns a string containing an xs:dateTime value formatted for display.

functions.name: format-date
functions.description: Returns a string containing an xs:date value formatted for display.

functions.name: format-date
functions.description: Returns a string containing an xs:date value formatted for display.

functions.name: format-time
functions.description: Returns a string containing an xs:time value formatted for display.

functions.name: format-time
functions.description: Returns a string containing an xs:time value formatted for display.

functions.name: parse-ietf-date
functions.description: Parses a string containing the date and time in IETF format, returning the corresponding xs:dateTime value.

functions.name: resolve-QName
functions.description: Returns an xs:QName value (that is, an expanded-QName) by taking an xs:string that has the lexical form of an xs:QName (a string in the form "prefix:local-name" or "local-name") and resolving it using the in-scope namespaces for a given element.

functions.name: QName
functions.description: Returns an xs:QName value formed using a supplied namespace URI and lexical QName.

functions.name: prefix-from-QName
functions.description: Returns the prefix component of the supplied QName.

functions.name: local-name-from-QName
functions.description: Returns the local part of the supplied QName.

functions.name: namespace-uri-from-QName
functions.description: Returns the namespace URI part of the supplied QName.

functions.name: namespace-uri-for-prefix
functions.description: Returns the namespace URI of one of the in-scope namespaces for $element, identified by its namespace prefix.

functions.name: in-scope-prefixes
functions.description: Returns the prefixes of the in-scope namespaces for an element node.

functions.name: empty
functions.description: Returns true if the argument is the empty sequence.

functions.name: exists
functions.description: Returns true if the argument is a non-empty sequence.

functions.name: head
functions.description: Returns the first item in a sequence.

functions.name: tail
functions.description: Returns all but the first item in a sequence.

functions.name: insert-before
functions.description: Returns a sequence constructed by inserting an item or a sequence of items at a given position within an existing sequence.

functions.name: remove
functions.description: Returns a new sequence containing all the items of $target except the item at position $position.

functions.name: reverse
functions.description: Reverses the order of items in a sequence.

functions.name: subsequence
functions.description: Returns the contiguous sequence of items in the value of $sourceSeq beginning at the position indicated by the value of $startingLoc and continuing for the number of items indicated by the value of $length.

functions.name: subsequence
functions.description: Returns the contiguous sequence of items in the value of $sourceSeq beginning at the position indicated by the value of $startingLoc and continuing for the number of items indicated by the value of $length.

functions.name: unordered
functions.description: Returns the items of $sourceSeq in an implementation-dependent order.

functions.name: distinct-values
functions.description: Returns the values that appear in a sequence, with duplicates eliminated.

functions.name: distinct-values
functions.description: Returns the values that appear in a sequence, with duplicates eliminated.

functions.name: index-of
functions.description: Returns a sequence of positive integers giving the positions within the sequence $seq of items that are equal to $search.

functions.name: index-of
functions.description: Returns a sequence of positive integers giving the positions within the sequence $seq of items that are equal to $search.

functions.name: deep-equal
functions.description: This function assesses whether two sequences are deep-equal to each other. To be deep-equal, they must contain items that are pairwise deep-equal; and for two items to be deep-equal, they must either be atomic values that compare equal, or nodes of the same kind, with the same name, whose children are deep-equal, or maps with matching entries, or arrays with matching members.

functions.name: deep-equal
functions.description: This function assesses whether two sequences are deep-equal to each other. To be deep-equal, they must contain items that are pairwise deep-equal; and for two items to be deep-equal, they must either be atomic values that compare equal, or nodes of the same kind, with the same name, whose children are deep-equal, or maps with matching entries, or arrays with matching members.

functions.name: zero-or-one
functions.description: Returns $arg if it contains zero or one items. Otherwise, raises an error.

functions.name: one-or-more
functions.description: Returns $arg if it contains one or more items. Otherwise, raises an error.

functions.name: exactly-one
functions.description: Returns $arg if it contains exactly one item. Otherwise, raises an error.

functions.name: count
functions.description: Returns the number of items in a sequence.

functions.name: avg
functions.description: Returns the average of the values in the input sequence $arg, that is, the sum of the values divided by the number of values.

functions.name: max
functions.description: Returns a value that is equal to the highest value appearing in the input sequence.

functions.name: max
functions.description: Returns a value that is equal to the highest value appearing in the input sequence.

functions.name: min
functions.description: Returns a value that is equal to the lowest value appearing in the input sequence.

functions.name: min
functions.description: Returns a value that is equal to the lowest value appearing in the input sequence.

functions.name: sum
functions.description: Returns a value obtained by adding together the values in $arg.

functions.name: sum
functions.description: Returns a value obtained by adding together the values in $arg.

functions.name: id
functions.description: Returns the sequence of element nodes that have an ID value matching the value of one or more of the IDREF values supplied in $arg.

functions.name: id
functions.description: Returns the sequence of element nodes that have an ID value matching the value of one or more of the IDREF values supplied in $arg.

functions.name: element-with-id
functions.description: Returns the sequence of element nodes that have an ID value matching the value of one or more of the IDREF values supplied in $arg.

functions.name: element-with-id
functions.description: Returns the sequence of element nodes that have an ID value matching the value of one or more of the IDREF values supplied in $arg.

functions.name: idref
functions.description: Returns the sequence of element or attribute nodes with an IDREF value matching the value of one or more of the ID values supplied in $arg.

functions.name: idref
functions.description: Returns the sequence of element or attribute nodes with an IDREF value matching the value of one or more of the ID values supplied in $arg.

functions.name: generate-id
functions.description: This function returns a string that uniquely identifies a given node.

functions.name: generate-id
functions.description: This function returns a string that uniquely identifies a given node.

functions.name: doc
functions.description: Retrieves a document using a URI supplied as an xs:string, and returns the corresponding document node.

functions.name: doc-available
functions.description: The function returns true if and only if the function call fn:doc($uri) would return a document node.

functions.name: collection
functions.description: Returns a sequence of items identified by a collection URI; or a default collection if no URI is supplied.

functions.name: collection
functions.description: Returns a sequence of items identified by a collection URI; or a default collection if no URI is supplied.

functions.name: uri-collection
functions.description: Returns a sequence of xs:anyURI values representing the URIs in a URI collection.

functions.name: uri-collection
functions.description: Returns a sequence of xs:anyURI values representing the URIs in a URI collection.

functions.name: unparsed-text
functions.description: The fn:unparsed-text function reads an external resource (for example, a file) and returns a string representation of the resource.

functions.name: unparsed-text
functions.description: The fn:unparsed-text function reads an external resource (for example, a file) and returns a string representation of the resource.

functions.name: unparsed-text-lines
functions.description: The fn:unparsed-text-lines function reads an external resource (for example, a file) and returns its contents as a sequence of strings, one for each line of text in the string representation of the resource.

functions.name: unparsed-text-lines
functions.description: The fn:unparsed-text-lines function reads an external resource (for example, a file) and returns its contents as a sequence of strings, one for each line of text in the string representation of the resource.

functions.name: unparsed-text-available
functions.description: Because errors in evaluating the fn:unparsed-text function are non-recoverable, these two functions are provided to allow an application to determine whether a call with particular arguments would succeed.

functions.name: unparsed-text-available
functions.description: Because errors in evaluating the fn:unparsed-text function are non-recoverable, these two functions are provided to allow an application to determine whether a call with particular arguments would succeed.

functions.name: environment-variable
functions.description: Returns the value of a system environment variable, if it exists.

functions.name: available-environment-variables
functions.description: Returns a list of environment variable names that are suitable for passing to fn:environment-variable, as a (possibly empty) sequence of strings.

functions.name: parse-xml
functions.description: This function takes as input an XML document represented as a string, and returns the document node at the root of an XDM tree representing the parsed document.

functions.name: parse-xml-fragment
functions.description: This function takes as input an XML external entity represented as a string, and returns the document node at the root of an XDM tree representing the parsed document fragment.

functions.name: serialize
functions.description: This function serializes the supplied input sequence $arg as described in , returning the serialized representation of the sequence as a string.

functions.name: serialize
functions.description: This function serializes the supplied input sequence $arg as described in , returning the serialized representation of the sequence as a string.

functions.name: function-lookup
functions.description: Returns the function having a given name and arity, if there is one.

functions.name: function-name
functions.description: Returns the name of the function identified by a function item.

functions.name: function-arity
functions.description: Returns the arity of the function identified by a function item.

functions.name: for-each
functions.description: Applies the function item $action to every item from the sequence $seq in turn, returning the concatenation of the resulting sequences in order.

functions.name: filter
functions.description: Returns those items from the sequence $seq for which the supplied function $f returns true.

functions.name: fold-left
functions.description: Processes the supplied sequence from left to right, applying the supplied function repeatedly to each item in turn, together with an accumulated result value.

functions.name: fold-right
functions.description: Processes the supplied sequence from right to left, applying the supplied function repeatedly to each item in turn, together with an accumulated result value.

functions.name: for-each-pair
functions.description: Applies the function item $action to successive pairs of items taken one from $seq1 and one from $seq2, returning the concatenation of the resulting sequences in order.

functions.name: sort
functions.description: Sorts a supplied sequence, based on the value of a sort key supplied as a function.

functions.name: sort
functions.description: Sorts a supplied sequence, based on the value of a sort key supplied as a function.

functions.name: sort
functions.description: Sorts a supplied sequence, based on the value of a sort key supplied as a function.

functions.name: apply
functions.description: Makes a dynamic call on a function with an argument list supplied in the form of an array.

functions.name: load-xquery-module
functions.description: Provides access to the public functions and global variables of a dynamically-loaded XQuery library module.

functions.name: load-xquery-module
functions.description: Provides access to the public functions and global variables of a dynamically-loaded XQuery library module.

functions.name: transform
functions.description: Invokes a transformation using a dynamically-loaded XSLT stylesheet.

functions.name: parse-json
functions.description: Parses a string supplied in the form of a JSON text, returning the results typically in the form of a map or array.

functions.name: parse-json
functions.description: Parses a string supplied in the form of a JSON text, returning the results typically in the form of a map or array.

functions.name: json-doc
functions.description: Reads an external resource containing JSON, and returns the result of parsing the resource as JSON.

functions.name: json-doc
functions.description: Reads an external resource containing JSON, and returns the result of parsing the resource as JSON.

functions.name: json-to-xml
functions.description: Parses a string supplied in the form of a JSON text, returning the results in the form of an XML document node.

functions.name: json-to-xml
functions.description: Parses a string supplied in the form of a JSON text, returning the results in the form of an XML document node.

functions.name: xml-to-json
functions.description: Converts an XML tree, whose format corresponds to the XML representation of JSON defined in this specification, into a string conforming to the JSON grammar.

functions.name: xml-to-json
functions.description: Converts an XML tree, whose format corresponds to the XML representation of JSON defined in this specification, into a string conforming to the JSON grammar.
